newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end down; banks liquidate funds.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end down; banks liquidate funds.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed lower on Friday as banks rushed to liquidate excess reserves following Thursday's holiday, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate ended at 5.648 percent against Wednesday's 5.856 close -- still outside the central bank's 5.00-5.5 percent target zone -- with 30-day commercial paper falling to 6.00 percent against 6.10.
The market was closed on Thursday because of Labour Day holiday.
In the bond market, the 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 6.1040 against 6.2090. -- James Lin (5080815)
